This is a follow-on implementing mechanism (IM) to the American Society for Microbiology (ASM) to strengthen the Ethiopian public laboratory network for clinical microbiology services. The follow-on IM will support the Ethiopian Health and Nutrition Research Institute (EHNRI) and regional laboratories to build local capacity and enhance technology in clinical microbiological diagnostics. The support focuses on:1)Upgrading national and regional Microbiology laboratories to enhance their role in the surveillance program and outbreak investigations 2) Developing practical mentorship tools to transfer skills to key laboratory personnel at EHNRI and regional Laboratories. Such laboratory capacity is critical for diagnosis and management of opportunistic and sexually transmitted infections 3)Microbiological laboratory service and TA for strengthening the National Microbiology Laboratory Network is now a top priority for the Federal Ministry of Health (FMOH). This includes advice on procurement of microbiological equipment and supplies, technical assistance on laboratory set-up, training of laboratory personnel on microbiological techniques, and development of guidelines, standard operating procedures, and training materials 4) Collaborate with EHNRI to strengthen laboratory support for the National TB Program.These are core PEPFAR activities that directly contribute to saving lives and preventing new infections. To be more cost efficient, this follow-on IM will gear its activities to key areas that bring more positive impact on the national laboratory system at large. It will work with the CDC-Ethiopia and EHNRI teams through teleconferencing and frequent e-mail communication, with limited travel to sites for key laboratory support areas such as targeted mentorship.
